Yeo said.
"Don't cause trouble unintentionally, bride.
How could the people around her know that she's abandoning herself to me?'
He then returned to the temple, cut off grains and put on scented oil.
In the first year of his ascension, he burned himself at the temple.
When the fire came, he chanted sūtras to his face without stopping.
He said to the nuns.
"I was able to collect two liters of my remains.
When the fire went out, it was just as he had said.
It was about a month or so before it burned.
There was a Hu Sen who was about 20 years old.
His features were straight, and he had hair on his scapular.
It was six or seven inches long.
It was extremely fine and soft.
People asked him about it.
The translator replied.
"It's never been covered, so that's why it's hairy.
He said to Yao.
"I've been staying in the country of Vārāṇasī.
I've been here for a few days.
I heard that my sister wanted to abandon her body.
That's why I gave you a silver bowl.
Yao then accepted it.
He hurriedly left before he could fully understand it.
He sent someone to follow him out the door and then he lost it.
He took this container and gave it to him for his relics.
It wasn't enough for two.
It was like this.
